total_impedance_ori_txt: L and R connected in series so Zb=j*w*L+R='6286.37 / 88.18°' Ohm
C and Zb connected in series so Za=1/(j*w*C)+Zb='6127.3 / 88.13°' Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '6127.3 / 88.13°' Ohm
total_impedance_txt: L and R connected in series so Zb=j*w*L+R='6286.37 / 88.18°' Ohm
C and Zb connected in series so Za=1/(j*w*C)+Zb='6127.3 / 88.13°' Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '6127.3 / 88.13°' Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on C?

solution: We know that generator frequency is f=1MEG Hz, w=2*pi*f
At first we calculate the total impedance between the generator nodes (Source)
L and R connected in series so Zb=j*w*L+R='6286.37 / 88.18°' Ohm
C and Zb connected in series so Za=1/(j*w*C)+Zb='6127.3 / 88.13°' Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '6127.3 / 88.13°' Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on C
We know that the voltage between Source nodes is '100 / 0°' V.
(1) The components C,Zb connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is '100 / 0°' V.
(1) C is in the voltage divider so the voltage on C is 1/(j*w*C)/Za*'100 / 0°' V = '2.6 / -178.13°' V.
